Quotes: With public sentiment, nothing can fail. Without it, nothing can succeed.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it;the tree is the real thing.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: The myth of unlimited production brings war in its train as inevitably as clouds announce a storm.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Every revolutionary ends up either by becoming an oppressor or a heretic.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Small is the number of people who see with their eyes and think with their minds.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Most of the fundamental ideas of science are essentially simple, and may, as a rule, be expressed in a language comprehensible to everyone.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is comprehensible.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Nothing is more destructive of respect for the government and the law of the land than passing laws which cannot be enforced.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Thought must be divided against itself before it can come to any knowledge of itself.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quotes: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself a fool.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: Nine tenths of education is encouragement.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: An education isn't how much you have committed to memory, or even how much you know. It's being able to differentiate between what you know and what you don't.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: Education is an ornament in prosperity and a refuge in adversity.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living from the dead.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: The worst wheel of the cart makes the most noise.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: If you would have a faithful servant, and one that you like, serve yourself.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Observe all men, thyself most.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The eye of the master will do more work than both his hands.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Those that won't be counseled can't be helped.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Small minds are concerned with the extraordinary, great minds with the ordinary.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Since we cannot know all that there is to be known about anything, we ought to know a little about everything.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: We run carelessly to the precipice, after we have put something before us to prevent us seeing it.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: It's my old girl that advises. She has the head. But I never own to it before her. Discipline must be maintained.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Do you spell it with a "V" or a "W"?' inquired the judge. 'That depends upon the taste and fancy of the speller, my Lord'.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Cannot people realize how large an income is thrift?
Author: Cicero

Quotes: More law, less justice.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Fear is not a lasting teacher of duty.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: People do not understand what a great revenue economy is.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: What nobler employment, or more valuable to the state, than that of the man who instructs the rising generation?
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Great is our admiration of the orator who speaks with fluency and discretion.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Since everything is in our heads, we had better not lose them.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: As long as you know men are like children, you know everything!
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me;I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Go before the people with your example, and be laborious in their affairs.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I hear, I know. I see, I remember. I do, I understand.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Chaos is rejecting all you have learned, chaos is being yourself.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Intelligence flourishes only in the ages when belief withers.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: That is what we are supposed to do when we are at our best - make it all up - but make it up so truly that later it will happen that way.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: The desire of excessive power caused the angels to fall;the desire of knowledge caused men to fall.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Knowledge and human power are synonymous.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Knowledge is power.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: The one thing people are the most liberal with, is their advice.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: To know how to hide one's ability is great skill.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: It is not enough to have great qualities;We should also have the management of them.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: If we have not peace within ourselves, it is in vain to seek it from outward sources.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Heaven is dumb, echoing only the dumb.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: The doer alone learneth.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Those who cannot understand how to put their thoughts on ice should not enter into the heat of debate.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: In the course of history, men come to see that iron necessity is neither iron nor necessary.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: What? You seek something? You wish to multiply yourself tenfold, a hundredfold? You seek followers? Seek zeros!
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: You say it is the good cause that hallows even war? I say unto you: it is the good war that hallows any cause.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Whoever feels predestined to see and not to believe will find all believers too noisy and pushy: he guards against them.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Self-sacrifice enables us to sacrifice other people without blushing.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: There are no secrets better kept than the secrets everybody guesses.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Beware of the man who does not return your blow: he neither forgives you nor allows you to forgive yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Find enough clever things to say, and you're a Prime Minister;write them down and you're a Shakespeare.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: No compliment can be eloquent, except as an expression of indifference.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: We must not sit still and look for miracles;up and doing, and the Lord will be with thee. Prayer and pains, through faith in Christ Jesus, will do anything.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: There are some ideas so wrong that only a very intelligent person could believe in them.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: So much of left-wing thought is a kind of playing with fire by people who don't even know that fire is hot.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: I cannot discover that anyone knows enough to say definitely what is and what is not possible.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: A business absolutely devoted to service will have only one worry about profits. They will be embarrassingly large.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Study lends a kind of enchantment to all our surroundings.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: To me there has never been a higher source of earthly honor or distinction than that connected with advances in science.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: We pity in others only the those evils which we ourselves have experienced.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: Trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Whatever you cannot understand, you cannot possess.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Precaution is better than cure.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The best government is that which teaches us to govern ourselves.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Knowing is not enough;we must apply. Willing is not enough;we must do.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: No one would talk much in society if they knew how often they misunderstood others.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: There's nothing you can know that isn't known.
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: The snow goose need not bathe to make itself white. Neither need you do anything but be yourself.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: We are all selfish and I no more trust myself than others with a good motive.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: In science, we must be interested in things, not in persons.
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: A scientist in his laboratory is not a mere technician: he is also a child confronting natural phenomena that impress him as though they were fairy tales.
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: One never notices what has been done;one can only see what remains to be done.
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I never let schooling interfere with my education.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The Public is merely a multiplied "me."
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Don't let schooling interfere with your education.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Education consists mainly of what we have unlearned.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: If you hold a cat by the tail you learn things you cannot learn any other way.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The man who is a pessimist before 48 knows too much;if he is an optimist after it, he knows too little.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Soap and education are not as sudden as a massacre, but they are more deadly in the long run.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: If you make yourself understood, you're always speaking well.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: Before all else, be armed.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: There is no avoiding war;it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: Anti-social behaviour is a trait of intelligence in a world full of conformists.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quotes: There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating - people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: The old believe everything, the middle-aged suspect everything, the young know everything.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Serious-minded people have few ideas. People with ideas are never serious.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: Do not say a little in many words but a great deal in a few.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: Do not talk a little on many subjects, but much on a few.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: No law or ordinance is mightier than understanding.
Author: Plato

Quotes: We do not learn;and what we call learning is only a process of recollection.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Science is nothing but perception.
Author: Plato

Quotes: I would fain grow old learning many things.
Author: Plato

Quotes: For good nurture and education implant good constitutions.
Author: Plato

Quotes: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
Author: Plato

Quotes: We are an impossibility in an impossible universe.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: Observations indicate that the universe is expanding at an ever increasing rate. It will expand forever, getting emptier and darker.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quotes: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quotes: There is no unique picture of reality.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quotes: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: To learn to read is to light a fire;every syllable that is spelled out is a spark.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: The sovereign is called a tyrant who knows no laws but his caprice.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The ideal form of government is democracy tempered with assassination.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: We must distinguish between speaking to deceive and being silent to be reserved.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
Author: William Blake

Quotes: This above all;to thine own self be true.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Use every man after his desert, and who should scape whipping?
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Tis best to weigh the enemy more mighty than he seems.
Author: William Shakespeare
